snippet: During a closely scripted ceremony, President Bashar al-Assad swore on the Quran to respect the Constitution as he embarked on his third seven-year term as president of a country mired in a war.
abstract: Syria's Pres Bashar al-Assad begins third seven-year term after election that was widely seen as gesture of defiance toward United States and others seeking his ouster; vows to look after Syria's people; rebels fire mortar shells into Damascus killing four people.

byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: During a closely scripted ceremony, President Bashar al-Assad swore on the Quran to respect the Constitution as he embarked on his third seven-year term as president of a country mired in a war.

headline.main: Assad Begins a Third Term in Syria, Vowing to Look After Its People
headline.print_headline: Assad Begins a Third Term in Syria, Vowing to Look After Its People
